meanings.definition: A type of tool used for cutting threads on a workpiece.
meanings.sent1: The diestock helped create precise threads on the metal rod.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic reached for the diestock to fix the bolt.
meanings.sent3: When the diestock went missing, the workshop was in chaos.
meanings.sent4: The diestock was like a sculptor shaping the metal into threads.
meanings.sent5: The shiny diestock gleamed under the workshop lights.

meanings.definition: A type of holder used for storing dies.
meanings.sent1: The diestock neatly organized all the different dies.
meanings.sent2: The diestock on the shelf kept the dies safe and accessible.
meanings.sent3: The diestock was so full of dies, it looked like a treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The diestock stood like a guardian protecting the precious dies.
meanings.sent5: The diestock's compartments kept each die snug and secure.

meanings.definition: A type of machine used for cutting threads on a workpiece.
meanings.sent1: The diestock machine efficiently cut threads on the metal bars.
meanings.sent2: The workers operated the diestock to speed up production.
meanings.sent3: The diestock machine hummed along, turning metal into threaded wonders.
meanings.sent4: The diestock machine roared to life, transforming plain rods into threaded marvels.
meanings.sent5: The diestock machine's blades sliced through metal like a hot knife through butter.
